name: "Black Lightning" -  "The Pilot" Quiz / Test | Television | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Cress Williams.

	The show is based on a comic book that debuted in April 1977. It was created by Tony Isabella and Trevor Von Eeden. the character has super reflexes, was a well-toned athlete and had the ability to create and manipulate electric charges. It was the first black superhero with his own title published by DC comics. Williams' career in television started in 1990. He has had roles on many popular shows, either as a recurring character or a guest actor. "Black Lightning" is his first headlining role.

questions.text: What was the name of the gang on the news in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
100 Gang.

	Intergang is another DC Comics based fictional entity. The Purple Dragons and the Foot Clan are both based on "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" comics and shows. The 100 Gang had shot 125 people over the weekend according to the news report in the opening scene of the show. The scene opened with a poem voice-over zooming into a man in a police department waiting room who was watching the news report.

questions.text: How long had Black Lightning been missing as of the pilot of the show?
questions.explanation:
9 years.

	According to the news report, Black Lightning had been fighting crime along with the police. He had disappeared 9 years prior to the opening of the series.  It was Jefferson Pierce who was waiting on his daughter in the police department. He was later pulled over while driving his two teenage daughters home.  After he was assaulted by the police, he got into a verbal argument with them, and ultimately decided to return to his roots as a superhero so he could help right the wrongs being committed in his city.

questions.text: What city is the show set in?
questions.explanation:
Freeland.

	All four cities are used in television shows based on DC Comics characters. The others belong to "Supergirl" (National City), "Arrow" (Star City) and "The Flash" (Central City).  Freeland is similar to Chicago if it was set in the real world. The city has a a major crime problem, and not enough resources to combat it.

questions.text: What type of job does Jefferson hold when not fighting crime?
questions.explanation:
School principal.

	Davis is a well respected member of the community in Freeland. He has worked for many years as a school teacher and principal. He gave up crime-fighting nearly a decade before the pilot so he could focus on family and helping the community in other ways.  He was also friends with the top detective on the Freeland Police Department as well. He had been the principal for 7 years as of the pilot episode.

questions.text: Black Lightning's daughter was kidnapped from a club and forced into slavery.
questions.explanation:
False.

	That nearly happened while she was at Club 100, which was run by the local gang. He showed up and broke up the party at the club, and managed to get himself shot in the process. His daughter escaped in the chaos.  She was later kidnapped from her father's school as well. Her older sister was the teacher at the time.

questions.text: What was the name of the gang leader who pulled a gun on Jefferson?
questions.explanation:
Lala.

	Lala, played by William Catlett, was a former student at Jefferson's school. He was the leader of the 100 Gang, and seemed to have a good relationship with Jefferson. After Jefferson reached out to him to have the violence at his school stopped, he pulled a gun on the principal. That was after Jefferson tried to stop him from yelling at a young boy who was a drug dealer for the gang. Shortly after Jefferson's daughter was kidnapped from the school and he donned the Black Lightning garb for the first time that wasn't in a flashback.

questions.text: Who designed Black Lightning's new suit?
questions.explanation:
Gambi.

	Peter Gambi, played by James Remar, was one of Jefferson's oldest friends. At one point in the episode he told Jefferson that he had known him so long he felt like his father. Gambi, always assuming Jefferson would retake the mantle of Black Lightning, developed a new state of the art suit for him and had it ready for when he finally returned.

questions.text: Black Lighting killed a gang member by throwing him through a car.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He did attack the man, played by actor-musician Dabier, but didn't kill him. Will (Dabier) was the one who had kidnapped his daughters. Black Lightning attacked him, and held him in the air with electricity, even smashed him into a car, but he was still alive after the encounter.

questions.text: Which of Black Lightning's daughters appeared to show signs of having her own powers at the end of the pilot?
questions.explanation:
Anissa.

	Anissa, after waking up from a bad dream, walked to the bathroom and accidently broke the sink into pieces. This was a precursor to her becoming Thunder. Nothing else was revealed about her powers in this episode.  She was played by Nafessa Williams.
